inkball

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.Line

  • public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
    The Line class represents a geometric line consisting of multiple points. It allows adding points, validating if the line is valid, and checking if a point lies on a line segment between two points.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<float[]> pointsArray
      record all points for current Line, we need to use it to draw line on App.draw()
      int pointsNum
      the number of points that line has

      Checks if a given point (px, py) lies on the line segment between points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2).

    • Method Detail

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(float mousex,
                     float mousey)
        Adds a new point to the line based on the given x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        mousex - The x-coordinate of the mouse (i.e. new point).
        mousey - The y-coordinate of the mouse (i.e. new point).

      • validLine

        public boolean validLine()
        if the line is valid, then it has at least two points.
        Returns:
        true if the line has two or more points, false otherwise.

      • isPointOnLineSegment

        public boolean isPointOnLineSegment(float px,
                                    float py,
                                    float x1,
                                    float y1,
                                    float x2,
                                    float y2)
        Checks if a given point (px, py) lies on the line segment between points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2). The method handles vertical, horizontal, and diagonal lines with an epsilon (0.01) tolerance for floating-point comparisons.
        Parameters:
        px - The x-coordinate of the point to check.
        py - The y-coordinate of the point to check.
        x1 - The x-coordinate of the first end point of the line segment.
        y1 - The y-coordinate of the first end point of the line segment.
        x2 - The x-coordinate of the second end point of the line segment.
        y2 - The y-coordinate of the second end point of the line segment.
        Returns:
        true if the point (px, py) lies on the line segment, false otherwise.
